blackjack

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackjack.CollectionOfCards
      • blackjack.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends CollectionOfCards
    This class inherits the class CollectionOfCards and also has two parameters: int total and boolean handCanBeHit.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pedro Esteves, Ricardo Cristino, Rui Br√°s

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean handCanBeHit
      The hand can be hit.
      private int total
      Total is the value of the hand handCanBeHit is a state that defines if a hand can receive another card or not.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      Constructs an empty LinkedList implicitly invoking super() constructor, also sets total to 0 and handCanBeHit to true.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void addCard(Card card)
      Adds a new card to the hand and sets the new value of the hand.
      boolean blackjack()
      Returns true if there are two cards in the hand and if the total performs 21.
      boolean canDouble()
      Checks if the hand has two cards and if the value of the hand is 9, 10 or 11.
      boolean cardsSameValue()
      Returns true if two cards have the same value.
      private int genTotal()
      Calculates the value of the hand, taking into account the soft and hard values of the cards.
      Card getFirst()
      Returns the first card of the hand list.
      boolean getHandCanBeHit()
      Returns handCanBeHit.
      int getTotal()
      Returns the total value.
      boolean isSoft()
      Determines if the hand is soft, it sums all soft values from the cards and compares to the total value calculated by method genTotal(), if it is equal, the method returns false.
      void setHandCanBeHit(boolean c)
      Sets the state variable hand can be hit to a boolean value received as input.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Prints the cards of the hand and the and's value.
      boolean twoAces()
      Returns true if there are two cards in the hand and if both have the same hard value 11.

        public boolean twoAces()
        Returns true if there are two cards in the hand and if both have the same hard value 11.
        Returns:

      • blackjack

        public boolean blackjack()
        Returns true if there are two cards in the hand and if the total performs 21.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • cardsSameValue

        public boolean cardsSameValue()
        Returns true if two cards have the same value. Checks if their are two cards in the hand and if they have the same soft value.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • canDouble

        public boolean canDouble()
        Checks if the hand has two cards and if the value of the hand is 9, 10 or 11. Returns true if hand can be doubled or false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • isSoft

        public boolean isSoft()
        Determines if the hand is soft, it sums all soft values from the cards and compares to the total value calculated by method genTotal(), if it is equal, the method returns false.
        Returns:
        true, if is soft
